summary: This document is an email chain from February 2020 discussing plans to re-engage and interview a witness or associate following Jeffrey Epstein's arrest. The correspondence involves law enforcement agents coordinating to confirm an individual's address and obtain a current cellphone number to schedule an interview.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of the investigation whose arrest prompted previous interviews with an individual the agents now wish to re-interview.

events.title: Planned witness interview
events.description: Law enforcement agents plan to interview an individual (whose name is not provided) on the upcoming Wednesday, following a previous interview conducted after Epstein's arrest.

events.title: Previous interviews after Epstein's arrest
events.description: Agents interviewed an individual in July 2019 following Jeffrey Epstein's arrest, and the individual was reportedly open to meeting again.

keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively working to re-engage with a witness or associate in February 2020, months after Epstein's arrest.
The individual had been interviewed previously in July 2019, shortly after Epstein's arrest, and was described as 'very open to meeting with us again'.
Agents were attempting to confirm the individual's current address and obtain a fresh cellphone number to schedule an interview.
The email chain indicates ongoing investigative efforts related to the Epstein case in early 2020.
